questions.question: 1. What does the accumulation region in the C-V curve of a PMOS capacitor indicate?

answers.b: Buildup of majority carriers near the oxide interface

questions.question: 2. How does temperature affect the threshold voltage (V_T) of a PMOS capacitor?
3. In C-V characterization, what is the main purpose of using high-frequency measurements?

answers.a: To measure the oxide breakdown voltage
answers.b: To avoid the response of minority carriers
answers.d: To increase the sensitivity of the measurements

questions.question: 4. What happens to the flat-band voltage if the gate material work function is increased?
5. What is the effect of interface trap charges on the C-V curve of a PMOS capacitor?

answers.a: It causes a shift in the C-V curve
answers.d: It has no effect on the C-V curve

questions.question: 6. Which parameter is directly measured from the C-V curve in accumulation?
7. What kind of shift in the C-V curve indicates the presence of fixed oxide charges?
8. In a PMOS C-V characterization, what does a higher inversion capacitance indicate?
9. How can one distinguish between mobile ion contamination and interface trap charges in a C-V curve?

answers.a: By measuring the curve at different temperatures
answers.c: By performing C-V measurements at different frequencies

questions.question: 10. Why does the inversion capacitance in a PMOS capacitor typically appear smaller than the oxide capacitance?

answers.a: Because of the series combination of oxide and depletion capacitance
answers.b: Due to the accumulation of majority carriers
answers.c: Because of a reduced doping concentration
